channel.title: Cybersecurity on faultint
channel.description: Recent content in Cybersecurity on faultint

item.title: CTF Hacker101 Flag 1 - A Little Something to Get You Started
item.description: Another challange I do while learning programming, this is episode 1 by the way. You can visit hacker101 if you want to play it too. I start the level and it redirected me to a website with white background and a paragraph which said: Welcome to level 0. Enjoy your stay. Nothing out of ordinary here. So, I inspect the page and look at the source code. Seems normal. Until I take a look at the <style> tag and saw the following lines:

item.title: OverTheWire Bandit 2
item.description: Continue to Level 2. Here is the level goal: The password for the next level is stored in a file called - located in the home directory I connected to the game server using the password from the previous level. The file needed to get the password for the next level is located at the home directory, so I just typed in: cat ./- And the content get printed. If I typed cat - the content inside - file won’t be printed since typing cat - means the cat command will read from standard input.

item.title: OverTheWire Bandit 1
item.description: After getting the password from Level 0, I connected to Level 1. Here is the level goal by the way. The password for the next level is stored in a file called readme located in the home directory. Use this password to log into bandit1 using SSH. Whenever you find a password for a level, use SSH (on port 2220) to log into that level and continue the game. This one is pretty straightforward.

item.title: OverTheWire Bandit 0
item.description: I’m currently doing Bandit wargames in overthewire website, while doing so I want to share my journey here. First level, it’s Level 0. The goal is to connect to the game server using ssh. This one is pretty straightforward, the only obstacle here is knowing how to use ssh. Since I’m in a linux machine, I can easily read the manpage for ssh command. The instruction for Level 0 is the following:
